result.execSummary:
The defendant William R Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid monthly, through probation.  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Maintain employment.  Not to terminate employment, without his agent's prior approval.
Not to be on the premises of either the Black River Falls or Eau Claire Walmart Stores.  Not to have any contact with their employees.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

records.addlTxt:
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Krische.  Plead guilty to Count 1. Count 2 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), contrary to 943.50(1m)(b).  Joint recommendation for:  Not to enter BRF or Eau Claire Walmart stores.  1 year probation.  Restitution.  DNA sample.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Concurrent with Eau Claire probation.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  Concurrent with probation now serving.   Not to on the premises of  BRF or Eau Claire Walmart stores, their employees or staff.  Restitution of $326.50.  Pay monthly through probation.,  Maintain  employment.  Not to terminate without his agent's prior approval.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  DNA sample.  CC.
Restitution worksheet.  Sent to Judge Becker electroncially.
Per telephone conference with Atty Krische, this matter taken of today's STC and scheduled for PLEAS.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant William R Clark in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Gerald Roger Fox appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Pleads NGP.  PTC 5-25 and STC 6-06 at 3:00.  Bond continued.

Report for booking.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: the Black River Falls Walmart, or it's employees.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Report for booking.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: the Black River Falls Walmart, or it's employees.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Attorney options explained by the court.  He will contact SPD.  AIA set for 5/2 at 9 am.
